Oh Kevin G hey go Mean Girls was a lot
of fun to shoot because no one on set
was a big star so there were no divas on
set the only sort of big name on set was
Lindsay and Lindsay at that point wasn't
a huge star I remember sitting in the
hair and makeup chair one morning and
asking the hairstylist you know how she
thought it would do she had worked on
some pretty big movies and she was like
oh please it's called Mean Girls and
it's starting Lindsay Lohan it's going
straight to DVD then Mean Girls came out
it became this big thing and I was
shocked and it still surprises me that
14 year-olds come up to me saying oh my
god you're Kevin gee when I auditioned
for Mean Girls I was at this point in my
life as an actor where I was so
frustrated with the stereotype parts
like mine were atypical this rapping
math guy that didn't have an Indian
accent in Bobble his head and I felt
like Tina Fey had written this accurate
depiction of what it meant to be a first
generation Indian guy in North America
on the set of Mean Girls the cameraman
had read a book and
he came up to me one day and was like
you're the lead character in this book I
just finished and I was like oh yeah
is he Brown he's like actually yeah he
is and the book happened to be Life of
Pi because here finally was that lead
role that wasn't playing the
stereotypical nerdy Indian kid this was
an authentic Indian kid and I made it my
mission to land that that part I dropped
out of college I flew to South India
where the book takes place I enrolled in
the boys school that PI attends this
little seminary called petite seminary
and I learned how to walk like those
Indian kids how to talk like them I
wanted to perfect that South Indian
accent the adaptation of the book went
through five different directors all the
while I continued to pour myself into
researching for this part this was
something that was to continue for six
years this stop-and-go pattern and then
a few months later after this six-year
journey I found out that Angley the
final director didn't want an actor he
wanted the real thing so I was kind of
crushed when I found out that someone
else was cast so I actually ended up
running away from home hi I moved to
Munich and I became a nanny for two
little kids running away was actually
kind of the best thing for me it allowed
me to kind of mourn the loss of this big
dream that I had had this huge goal that
I chased after I really learned that you
know you shouldn't let the fear of
failure stand in your way if you're
willing to take chances amazing things
can happen I had come back to Toronto a
couple of times and I had very casually
started this calligraphy business so I
was doing chalkboard menus at
restaurants and cafes in Toronto and it
kind of became a thing so I run a
calligraphy business out of New York
called letters in ink I'm now an author
and I still continue to audition for TV
shows and movies while people are
looking at the book considering turning
it into a movie and I would love for
that to happen I think it would be so
ironic if the role that I ended up
playing was myself Woody Allen
where are you put your next movie is
this right here woody
